Package jdw.graphics

This package contains classes supporting the creation of 3D environments.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Environment3DChangeListener This interface receives events as objects (primitives, meshes, lights) are added and removed to/from an Environment3D.
RenderListener This interface receives events related to rendering.
 

Class Summary
DirectionalLight A directional light is a light with color and direction, but no position.
Environment3D A 3D environment into which primitives are placed.
Environment3DChangeEvent Represents the event that the state of an Environment3D changed.
Environment3DInfo Displays information about an Environment3D object and the primitives, meshes and lights it contains.
FrameRenderingEvent Represents the event that a frame is about to be rendered.
Light Identifies a source of light.
Material A material specifies the types and colors of light reflected by a primitive.
Matrix A 4x4 matrix.
Mesh Represents a Direct3D mesh.
NativeCanvas Allows some native code to render the graphics for this canvas.
PointLight A point light is a light that has a position and a color and radiates light in all directions.
Primitive Primitives are objects that can be placed into an Environment3D.
SpotLight A spot light is a light with color, direction, and a position.
Texture Represents either a texture surface that can be applied to a Primitive, or an image surface that can be used as a background for a 3D scene.
Vector3D Describes a vector in three-dimensional (3D) space.
Vertex A vertex is a point that defines where two edges of a shape come together.
WindowManager Provides some functions that operate on windows.
 

Enum Summary
RenderMode A RenderMode is applied to a primitive and specifies how the vertices of that primitive are interpreted.
 

Package jdw.graphics Description

This package contains classes supporting the creation of 3D environments.
